qas.question: Did the FBI investigate Martin Luther King Jr.?
Who did MLK begin criticizing in the mid-1960s?
What group did MLK believe needed more attention from the FBI?
What kind of letter did the FBI send to MLK?
When did King publicly praise the FBI?
What group did the FBI believe needed more attention?
What kind of letter did MLK send to the FBI?
What year did King send a package to the FBI?

context: The FBI <a0_0>frequently<a0_0/> investigated Martin Luther King, Jr. In the <b5_0>mid-1960s<b5_0/>, King began publicly criticizing <a1_0>the Bureau<a1_0/> for giving insufficient attention to the use of terrorism by <a2_0><b6_0>white supremacists<b6_0/><a2_0/>. Hoover responded by publicly calling King the most "<a3_0><b7_0>notorious liar<b7_0/><a3_0/>" in the United States. In his 1991 memoir, Washington Post journalist Carl Rowan asserted that the FBI had sent at least one <a4_0><b8_0>anonymous<b8_0/><a4_0/> letter to King encouraging him to commit suicide. Historian Taylor Branch documents an anonymous November <b9_0>1964<b9_0/> "suicide package" sent by the Bureau that combined a letter to the civil rights leader telling him "You are done. There is only one way out for you..." with audio recordings of King's sexual indiscretions.
